result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremiah King Arthur Pettigrue in court, in custody from WCJ.  Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court for Jeremiah King Arthur Pettigrue. Victims mother is also present.  Information rec'd and reading waived; Court reviews information with defendant; Statements from State; PSI requested and State agrees to cap the initial confinement recommendation to 5 years and recommendation for extended supervision will be dependent on PSI, Defense is free to argue. No contest plea entered.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and orders PSI

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremiah King Arthur Pettigrue in court.   Attorney Edgar A Beltran as a friend of the court, in court for Jeremiah King Arthur Pettigrue. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Atty. Beltran states there is a conflict so an attorney will be appointed.  Victims family member also appears.  Defendant states is employed part-time.  State requests $25,000.00 cash bond.  Atty. Beltran requests a signature bond and makes argument for same.  State informs on previous case in 21CF425.  Court orders $25,000.00 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing.
